basics.name: Amanda Splink
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software engineer with more than three years of experience in programming and a well-rounded background in mathematics, teaching, consulting, and virtualization. Looking for an opportunity to collaborate on a team to deliver a high quality experience and excellent support to customers. As a hard working and amiable individual, I am quick to pick up on team standards, learn new technologies, and provide value as a front-end developer. I am always looking for ways to inspire and be inspired by creative ideas and implementations for enabling healthy and fun lifestyles.

work.summary: Built a community focused application to facilitate task management for groups of people.
highlights: Created and maintained all aspects of the React/Redux front-end system.
Maintained a high level of automated code coverage using Mocha and NightwatchJS.
Created plugin functionality via dependency injection and maintained the feature segmented module system.
Utilized Phabricator to create, sharpen, and maintain a highly organized Agile development and code review process.

work.summary: Designed and created a custom built wedding website to provide information to and collect rsvps from guests, including an administrator login UI for tracking rsvps.
highlights: Integrated React/Redux frontend with PostgreSQL and PostgREST backend, using a custom built middleware for easy api handling.

work.summary: Led and managed over 10 multi-week, customer-facing virtualization projects including assessments, designs, implementations, and issue resolutions.
highlights: Collected and analyzed information on virtualization environment users, access, resources, controllers, networking, storage, and operations, and provided recommendations and implemented solutions according to Citrix best practices.
Awarded 'Wile E. Coyote - Courage Under Fire' award within the consulting team for delivering on projects and maintaining professionalism under tough conditions.
Awarded 'Top Gun', a special designation to a small selection of consultants for their hard work and success in the field.
Demoed/tested new product features for internal knowledge base.
Organized quarterly team events and yearly volunteer activities.
Created yearly, consulting-wide job quality survey.
Mentored and provided constructive feedback to second resources and shadow resources on projects.

work.summary: Collaborated on over 25 multi-week, customer-facing virtualization projects.
highlights: Led significant work streams on projects including customer discussions, presentations, and design implementations.
Created assessment, design, and build documentation for customer virtualization environments.

work.summary: Completed a six months rigorous training program on virtualization and networking products as well as soft skills training.
highlights: Acquired Citrix Certified Enterprise Engineer (CCEE) for Virtualization and Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) certificates
Shadowed and assisted on numerous consulting projects.
Led customer-facing demonstrations on the Citrix virtualization product suite.
Provided the Inside Sales team with technical support on customer questions and calls.
Generated over $5.5M in pipeline by answering requests for proposals from various clients.

work.summary: Provided support to petroleum engineers through database management, data loading, and preparing client reports for oil and gas reserve evaluations.
Taught 120 students in two classes of 9th grade Algebra 1 and three classes of 10th grade Geometry.
highlights: Researched and collaborated with other teachers to create and provide student-centered instruction and engagement.
Raised student achievement by reaching goal of 85% passing rate on state standardized test.
Volunteered time to help with Richardson High School's UIL Math team.

volunteer.summary: Volunteered 20 hours a week, interacting with patients and cooperating with nurses and doctors in Spanish.
